t: Psalm 55
For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A maskil of David.
Listen*pn to my prayer, O God, do*ld not ignore my plea;
hear*ld me and answer me. My*ln thoughts trouble me and I am distraught
because*ld of what my enemy is saying, because*ld of the threats of the wicked; for*ln they bring down suffering on me and*ld assail me in their anger.
My*pn heart is in anguish within me; the*ld terrors of death have fallen on me.
Fear*ln and trembling have beset me; horror*ld has overwhelmed me.
I*ln said, “Oh, that I had the wings of a dove! I*ld would fly away and be at rest.
I*ln would flee far away and*ld stay in the desert;
I*ln would hurry to my place of shelter, far*ld from the tempest and storm.”
Lord,*pn confuse the wicked, confound their words, for*ld I see violence and strife in the city.
Day*ln and night they prowl about on its walls; malice*ld and abuse are within it.
Destructive*ln forces are at work in the city; threats*ld and lies never leave its streets.
If*pn an enemy were insulting me, I*ld could endure it; if*ln a foe were rising against me, I*ld could hide.
But*ln it is you, a man like myself, my*ld companion, my close friend,
with*ln whom I once enjoyed sweet fellowship at*ld the house of God, as*ln we walked about among*ld the worshipers.
Let*pn death take my enemies by surprise; let*ld them go down alive to the realm of the dead, for*ld evil finds lodging among them.
As*pn for me, I call to God, and*ld the Lord*s saves me.
Evening,*ln morning and noon I*ld cry out in distress, and*ld he hears my voice.
He*ln rescues me unharmed from*ld the battle waged against me, even*ld though many oppose me.
God,*ln who is enthroned from of old, who*ld does not change— he*ln will hear them and humble them, because*ld they have no fear of God.
My*pn companion attacks his friends; he*ld violates his covenant.
His*ln talk is smooth as butter, yet*ld war is in his heart; his*ln words are more soothing than oil, yet*ld they are drawn swords.
Cast*pn your cares on the Lord*s and*ld he will sustain you; he*ln will never let the*ld righteous be shaken.
But*ln you, God, will bring down the wicked into*ld the pit of decay; the*ln bloodthirsty and deceitful will*ld not live out half their days. But*pn as for me, I trust in you.
